title: Specifying package version in packages.yaml throws datetime.date schema error
body:
I am attempting to restrict versions of a given package, r3d, in my `packages.yaml` file, and in doing so, Spack is throwing the following error:

```console
$ spack spec r3d
Input spec
--------------------------------
r3d

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: <unknown file>: datetime.date(2018, 12, 19) is not valid under any of the given schemas
```

The issue appears to be entirely related to the "date" format of the actual package version, "2018-12-19" during concretization.  Replacing dashes with dots or no characters at all permits proper operation.  Success is also seen if I remove the version stanza entirely from the `packages.yaml` file.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Edit your packages.yaml file and insert the following stanza:

```console
  r3d:
    version: [2018-12-19]
```
and then issue this command:
```console
$ spack spec r3d
```
